page.title: 12TAF FECHAN WATER BOARD
page.content: Below the Pontsticill reservoir stand the filter houses which purify the water before it is piped to the towns of Merthyr Tydfil, Pontypridd and even as far away as Caerphilly.The reservoir was built in 1927 to provide water for the town.The valley was chosen to be flooded because of its suitable shape and because of the heavy rainfall it received.The people who lived in the villige were given new land to build apon for their own houses had been flooded.The dam was hand built and took over a year to complete.Gangs of men puddled a clay core with wooden tools.Inside the filter house, there were rows of big tanks purifying the water, which came in from the reservoir.Then air is blown up from the level of sand, which takes all of the dirt out.Then the same water became clean and drinkable.
